conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph to determine if the particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
The graph shows the velocity v of the particle as a function of time t.
The graph shows a curve that starts at a velocity of 20 m/s at t = 0.
The velocity decreases over time, reaching a minimum velocity of 10 m/s at t = 2 seconds.
The velocity then increases again, reaching a maximum velocity of 20 m/s at t = 3 seconds.
Acceleration is the change in velocity over the change in time.
From 1 to 2 seconds, the velocity decreases from 20 m/s to 10 m/s.
The change in velocity is 20 m/s - 10 m/s = 10 m/s.
The change in time is 2 s - 1 s = 1 s.
The acceleration is 10 m/s / 1 s = 10 m/s².
The particle's acceleration is not gradually decreasing from 1 to 2 seconds; it is constant at 10 m/s².
